description: Add a visually-hidden skip link for keyboard navigation accessibility. Allows keyboard users to bypass the navigation and jump directly to main content.

phases.name: CSS Implementation
phases.description: Add the visually-hidden utility class and skip link styles to the existing CSS

subtasks.title: Add visually-hidden CSS class
subtasks.description: Create a .visually-hidden CSS class that hides content visually but keeps it accessible to screen readers. Uses the standard clip-rect technique recommended by WCAG.
acceptance_criteria: Class uses position: absolute with clip technique
Content is hidden from visual display
Content remains accessible to screen readers
Follows WCAG 2.1 guidelines for visually hidden content

subtasks.title: Add skip-link focus styles
subtasks.description: Create .skip-link class with :focus-visible styles that show the link when focused. Use --color-teal-500 for focus state, positioned fixed at top of viewport for maximum visibility.
acceptance_criteria: Link is visible only when focused
Uses --color-teal-500 for background/border highlighting
Positioned at top-left of viewport when visible
Has appropriate padding, background color, and z-index for visibility
High contrast text for accessibility

phases.name: HTML Implementation
phases.description: Add the skip link element and target anchor to the page structure

subtasks.title: Add main-content id target
subtasks.description: Add id='main-content' to the <main class='site-main'> element to serve as the skip link destination anchor.
acceptance_criteria: id='main-content' added to <main class='site-main'> element
ID is unique on the page
tabindex='-1' added to allow focus from skip link

subtasks.title: Add skip-to-content link element
subtasks.description: Add the skip link as the first element inside <body>, before the site-container div. Link should use skip-link class and link to #main-content.
acceptance_criteria: Skip link is first element in body
Link text is 'Skip to main content'
href points to #main-content anchor
Uses skip-link class for styling

phases.name: Testing & Verification
phases.description: Verify the skip link works correctly for keyboard navigation and screen readers

subtasks.title: Keyboard navigation testing
subtasks.description: Verify skip link behavior with keyboard navigation: Tab reveals link, Enter activates it, focus moves to main content.
acceptance_criteria: Tab key reveals skip link as first focusable element
Skip link text is clearly visible when focused
Enter/Space key on skip link moves focus to main content
Skip link is hidden when not focused
No layout shift when skip link appears/disappears

subtasks.title: HTML validation
subtasks.description: Ensure HTML remains valid after changes and no accessibility issues are introduced.
acceptance_criteria: HTML validates without errors
No duplicate IDs on page
Link has appropriate accessible name

final_acceptance: Skip link is first focusable element on page
Link is hidden until focused via keyboard
Activating link moves focus to main content area
No visual regression when link is not focused
